answers: Xenopus laevis [or X laevis or African clawed frog; prompt on "frog"]
parts: Name this phylum of simple animals which includes hydras, jellyfish, and sea anemones.
Cnidarians lack this middle germ layer, which in humans is sandwiched between the ectoderm and endoderm and develops into the connective tissues and muscles of the body.
A common model organism used to study development is this amphibian, which is useful due to its large oocytes. The gray crescent appears on the dorsal side of its embryo during gastrulation.
Name this symphony, whose second part is based on the final scene from Faust, Part Two. It begins with a setting of the hymn "Veni, creator spiritus
The "Symphony of a Thousand" was written by this Austrian composer of The Song of the Earth, whose second symphony is nicknamed "Resurrection."
Mahler's score also calls for this keyboard instrument that produces sound by striking metal bars. Tchaikovsky featured it in his "Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy."
